comment: Extremely laid back class. All assignments and tests are open note and can be all taken outside of class. The easiest class you'll have.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Hilarious--Graded by few things

comment: Very laid back class. Very nice and straightforward. Not a huge workload. Get your work done and turned in on time, and you will pass with an A. I would 100% recommend taking him. Gives grace periods very often. Pops jokes and is actually engaging.

Even though I am an engineering student, I was required to take this course for my pathway. It was a 6 PM class in person, but he decided that clearly nobody wants to be there that late at school so he made the class on zoom and optional. The homeworks are easy quizzes and the tests which there are 2 are just made up of previous quizzes.
Impossible to fail his class, has extra credit as well. Not the best for actually learning econ, but if you only need the credit please take him

If you are taking this class to actually learn economics, don't take it with Dr. Spears, but for someone needing an economics credit his class was very easy. I only needed to go to the class two times the whole semester and the quizzes and tests are super easy.
Easy class; won't learn much. Professor can go on a lot of random tangents in class.

Offered extra credit for positive ratemyprofessor reviews. Difficult to reach, threatened to take away extra credit if anyone emailed/texted him over the weekend before the test. Was always 5 minutes late to class. Came to class hungover. He is a funny guy, but not a great teacher.

He is a pretty good professor. He has his class set up in a way that makes it almost impossible to fail (only way you could fail is if you do literally nothing). You will have to do some work and make sure you really understand the material but overall, his class is good.
Amazing teacher!
He is a chill guy. I think it's impossible to fail he helps you pass
He is a chill guy.
Great teacher who helped me understand economics better!
Great teacher made sure I understood all the subjects 100 percent.
Very light course load.
Professor Spears's class is very manageable and easy as long as you attend class and take advantage of opportunities. Very light workload and makes it easy to understand.
Very good teacher, offers a lot of extra credit.
Great teacher, easy to follow lectures and easy tests
good lecturer and very clear with instructions. Professor gives extra credit opportunities.
He is always thorough with his lectures and willing to give extra credit.
Great guy, great lecturer
Very easy class, if you come to class he'll give you a simple 20pt attendance quiz. All exams are open note.
He gives 20pt attendance quizzes if you come to class but it's not mandatory. No homework and all exams are open note.
If you're going to be taking Econ 1000, take Professor Spears. He's a great professor and cares about the students he's teaching. There shouldn't be any reasons you do not pass his  class

Dr. Spears is very easy-going professor while still being professional. Lectures are easy to understand as long as you pay attention, and if you pay attention while consistently practicing, it would be easier to get an A than to actually fail. Not a difficult class and he will work with you if you are having difficulties, personal or academic.
Attendance encouraged but not mandatory. Straight forward class structure and easy to pass if you just do what you're supposed to.

He is very funny and Isn't strict at all when it comes to work. You can use your notes on exams and you have a  very light homework load. The only thing you have to do really is show up to class. Attendance isn't necessary but he does do little quizzes everyday for attendance so its good not to miss that. He is a great professor and very engaging.
No homework, gives extra credit opportunities, only 4 exams (last is optional final). Would take this professor again!
He's super educated on the topic, doesn't read directly from slideshow, gets us out of class quick.

If you don't understand the topics already or delve into them in your own time, good luck on the exams. There is no other graded work and 90% of the time the material is not what was covered in the lectures. You would be better off reading the textbook as he is always late and manages to talk the whole time without any actual information.
There's no assignments, no quizzes , the classes are short. just study honestly & you'll be good.

As a first-year class, Dr. Spears' Contemporary Economic Issues class was a good introduction to basic economic concepts and ideas.  He is very approachable about issues like extra credit and missing class. All in all, he is a very relaxed yet engaging teacher and a good experience for first year students or people new to economics.

He is a very good professor that explains the topics thoroughly and explains further in depth when people ask about it. He's very easy going and a fun professor to have for the semester. Highly recommend!
he's good at explaining the content.
Good Professor, I would take him again. Just focus and study a little and you will do fine.
Spears is really funny and makes his lessons  about economics very interesting, also lots of options for extra credit

This professor is light with grading and offers many ways to improve your grade. He provides extra credit quizzes every day which are not mandatory and can help improve your grade. He also offers the use of notes of the exams which is a nice bonus. Great professor would take again.

Great lecturer. He's good at keeping the content engaging and using real world examples to help students get a grasp of difficult concepts. His lessons are very interactive, as he encourages students to ask questions and participate in his examples!
Professor spears is a great professor he made the class very easy for everyone.
Great Professor
He explains the topics very well with relatable analogies to economics making it easy to understand.
Show up to class to save your grade

Honestly, I was a little worried going into an economics class because I have always struggled with the concept of economics in general, but it was one of the easiest classes I have ever taken. Like, trust me, if you show up, do your work, and write notes, you will be just fine. He's also super real and funny, so the lectures are fun.

The course is not complicated and he explains it in an easy to understand manner. he's really chill and doesn't give a lot of assignments which makes the course easy to balance with other courses. I would have this prof again and recommend others to have him in the future.

Professor Spears was an awesome professor. His lectures are interesting and he relates the material in a way that the students would really understand. Attendance is mandatory and there are attendance quizzes that are very easy. Extra credit is given towards the end of the semester. I would definitely recommend Professor Spears.

Professor Russell Spears is a hilarious professor. He is very understanding when it comes to the busy schedules of college students, and he is able to stoop down to our level to help us better understand the material in his class. If you do take him, remember that attendance isn't mandatory but it is essential when considering your final grade.

Professor Spears is a good professor to have if you just need to get your econ credit out of the way. His quizzes are easy and based on if you attend class or not. Make sure to review your notes and really study the practice tests he provides as well as doing your own studying outside of the classroom to ensure a good grade.

Professor Spears was a great instructor. His lectures were straightforward, and test questions came directly from class material, so taking good notes and reviewing PowerPoints is key. He offers many attendance quizzes that are easy to score well on. Overall, I enjoyed the class and would take it again.

There are attendance quizzes and they don't hurt you if you aren't there to take them but they do help you in the end. Just make sure you attend class. Those attendance quizzes are easy A's. Make sure that you are in class because he makes a lot of his announcements in class as well. All in all, I would take another class with Dr. Spears again.

Professor Spears was great. There are multiple opportunities for extra credit. His lectures are very straightforward and he always posts the slideshows. The exams are simple but can be confusing so be prepared to take notes and study.
He's a great professor.

Professor Spears is really fun and easy going. His lectures are clear and engaging and he creates an interactive classroom environment, encouraging questions and participation. Outside of class, he is approachable and provide helpful feedback, ensuring students feel supported.

Professor Russell's Econ class is a great class to take, I never had to do work outside of his class other than studying. At the end of his lectures he gives the class a one question quiz which is very easy to pass, and this course is the most laid back course compared to my other courses. This class is pretty much an easy A or B.

Spears is a great professor if you're looking for a laid back DIY class. Gives you what you need to succeed, and its up to you to decide how you make due of the information. You're practically guaranteed a good grade in this class if you simply show up take some notes. Class typically ended early, and he made some lectures fun/interesting.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He is a good professor show up to class if you can't make it the slides are always posted and he does his best with extra credit never wants anyone to fail.

The professor and class was very chill and laid back. There are only 2 types of things that are graded, those being the Test, and practice tests, both are open note, and the latter can be taken as many times as you want!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: He gives many opportunities to make up points/get extra credit. The only bad part about the class is the exams, but if you pay attention and take notes you'll be fine.
He gives you a lot of chances to get points for your grade, the only bad part is the exams. But if you actually pay attention and take notes you'll be fine.
Great teacher and class. Attendance isn't mandatory but can help your grade a lot so I would always go to class. Test are okay as long as you listen and take notes.
He likes to pick on students so if you don't like that sit in the back. Otherwise he's pretty funny and good at relating to his students.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Throughout my time at KSU, Spears is one of my favorite professors I've had. Lecture attendance is for extra credit and classes are very engaging and entertaining. I have learned many things from this course (you will get festive lessons- we learned a lot about the history of haunted houses around Halloween!!) and liked its straightforwardness.
Dr. Spears is very effective at teaching and allowing for students to learn. The most important thing is just to show up.
This class was super easy. There are three exams and for all of them you can use your notes. Attendance isn't mandatory but if you do go, there's an end of lecture quiz for bonus points.

Definitely don't take him if you want an easy A with minimal effort. His test were a lot harder than what he taught in lectures. I got a 65, 70, and 75 on three test (all open notes) and ended with a B just by going to every class for extra credit. He's cool, but i sure there are easier/better professors for this class.

He is very generous and wants you to do well. He knows his material and has PowerPoints but explains them instead of just read off of them. He presents the material in a fun and enjoyable way. He gives great examples and welcomes class participation.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Professor spears is great! Did a very good job class was fun the lectures are simple, the class time was managed very well and I think it's very hard to fail this class.

I loved this class! There are very few assignments, only attendance quizzes, and practice exams. All tests are open note, and very easy to pass. He will curve tests, and gives lots of extra credit opportunities as well! Just show up to class, and you will do fine.
rating_tags: Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT--Graded by few things

comment: TAKE HIM!!! He is so sweet and such a good professor!
Take professor spears for Econ 1000. He teaches well and I promise you'll pass.

Attendance isn't mandatory, but you can get extra points by showing up to class. There's not a lot of assignments, so the attendance points can make a huge difference. Lectures aren't just reading from a slide, so they aren't super boring. Theres always a review for the exam and opportunities for extra credit. Super straightforward and easy class.
Class was pretty easy and chill. Just show up to class for the lectures and take the attendance quizzes. Also study for the test.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Overall is a great professor though there are few grades in the class being graded only on tests can be difficult if you are not a great test taker. There are also random attendance quizzes which are based on the lecture of the day. At the end of the semester he did offer three extra credit opportunities.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Overall, an easy course. Lectures won't bore you, tests are open note, and no homework assigned. Attendance isn't mandatory but going to his lectures and taking the attendance quizzes helps your grade (but won't hurt it). Enjoyable course with an enjoyable instructor.
Great Professor, Take him!
Explains the material in class very well, and no homework. Only 4 exams and participating quiz after each lecture, which are very easy.

For someone who isn't the best within learning economics, this professor knows how to teach economics while also providing multiple opportunities to up your grade if necessary. I would recommend them if you want a lecture that isn't rough to understand or provides a stressful environment.
Overall Professor Spears was funny and I thought he did a pretty good job teaching the material. I don't have any complaints and would not be disappointed if he were to be my professor again.

Really great professor would definitely recommend! All of the lecture content is posted on D2L and there is barely any homework. Tests are very straightforward and based on the material covered in class.
His lectures are very full of life, the tests are very simple, and he makes sure that you have as much resources as possible in order to succeed in his class.

Spears is  laid-back but respectable. Easy to come to with  questions you  have and criteria is mainly slide based with further elaboration. The class is not hard to understand, failing is nearly impossible. Very relaxed and stress-free, just keep up with exam dates and slides and come to him with concerns because he WILL help—highly recommend!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Honestly this was literally the easiest class I've ever taken, all his tests are open note and he is a very good teacher.
He's a very good professor
This professor is very relaxed and helpful. You will do fine if you attend class or re-read the lectures he posts. Allows use of notes for tests.
Great professor. really wants to see his students succeed. Does anything that he can to help you understand .

Dr. Spears is a great teacher. Not only is this an easy class, but there is also no homework. Attendance quizzes for credit are super easy as long as you mildly pay attention. There are a few exams, and they aren't long. The final is not cumulative, and the exam criteria are clear. Dr. Spears is chill and gives great lectures.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Spears was a very relax and easy teacher. He was very straight to the point with his lectures and didn't give any homework. Attendance wasn't mandatory and was used as extra credit if you went.

Very easy class, no homework, attendance was extra credit but it adds to your grade so just show up. As long as you show up to the lectures, pay attention, and take notes you'll do well on the tests which is the majority of the grade for the class aside from attendance quizzes.
Dr spears is very laidback and easy going. he doesn't assign any homeworks and let you have open notes on the test.
Dr.Spears was great. He is very laidback, easy going, lectures are interesting and he has sense of humor. the tests are also open notes. I would definitely take again!
makes it easy to succeed, but know that if you bomb 1 test, it's hard to recover.
Very cool and laid back professor doesn't assign homework and is good at explaining subject matter.
Very cool professor doesn't assign homework and explains subjects very well.
He's such a cool professor, doesn't assign homework, and very funny but he also explains the subject matter very well. Would definitely take again!
He doesn't give many grades but ALWAYS do the mini quizzes. they help so much.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: he was really sweet and gave us different extra credit opportunities:)
Mr.Spears is very easy going. He makes the class a lot easier helping us succeed.

Super laid back while still being clear about expectations. Deadlines and class norms are communicated early on, so you know what's expected. I really appreciated that attendance was rewarded with credit, it's a great incentive to stay engaged. If you show up and put in a little effort, you'll do well. Definitely recommend taking.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: He was a great professor. Attendance is not mandatory, but very helpful for your grade. The course is lectured based, but the professor makes the content easy to understand. The 4 exams are open note, but I recommend studying either way. Great econ class!
Lecture based course. no asignment but has attendance quizzes to boost your grade. Four tests including the final are all open note.

The class is very much based on lectures but has no assignments. There are four tests throughout the semester and weekly attendance quizzes that make up your whole grade. Overall, he is a very nice teacher who teaches through stories.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This is by far the easiest prof I've ever had. He's pretty nonchalant. My class was MWF but we only had class WF. The tests are easy and he lets us use our notes and the powerpoints he teaches off of. He's a very chill professor.
Dr. Spears was great. Lectures were interesting, tests were open note, and quizzes were easy. It's probably one of the easiest courses I've ever taken. If you can take his course!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Spears was great, lectures were interesting, attendance quizzes were easy if you listened to the lecture, and tests were open note. He was very laid back and made the course almost impossible to fail. If you can you absolutely should Dr. Spears!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: He is a very good teacher; He wants you to pass. If you pay attention, you'll do good. He also makes lectures interesting.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Spears in relatable and funny as well as knowledgeable. He clearly knows what he's talking about. Would take again
Dr. Spears is relatable and funny as well as knowledgeable. He clearly knows what he's talking about and makes lectures as engaging as possible. Would take another class from him.
Super cool and chill. Easy A.
This professor was an overall great teacher. I definitely recommend you guys to take him!!
Very engaging with students, has an amazing sense of humor, very easygoing class.
Very funny professor, easy going, and a light course load.

This class was very easy to be successful in. The professor made all expectations straightforward and if you had any questions, he was very easily approachable. Attendance was optional but if you came to class, you had the opportunity to take an attendance quiz to go toward your grade.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Spears is a breath of fresh air. He tells everyone on the first day that attendance is OPTIONAL and so is THE FINAL but if you decide to attend class he does a quiz during class that is usually something simple like "What did we talk about today?" for an easy 10 points. If you want a easier class one semester then pick his class fast!

This professor was really easy. The lectures were simple to follow, and they didn't make the material too hard to understand. There were lots of extra credit quizzes throughout the semester, and they were super easy to do. Grading was fair, and if you put in a little effort, you could easily pass the class.
Offers extra credit attendance quizzes and lets you use your notes and power points on the tests.

Spears is a funny and laid-back professor. There is an attendance quiz at the end of class, but only a handful get put into the gradebook. So even though, attendance isn't mandatory going to class and taking these quizzes can boost a grade a little in the long run. During exams, he lets you use your notes and the PowerPoints from that unit.

Great professor and nice guy. He gives attendance quizzes that can only help you not hurt you. There aren't many grades for this class other than 3 exams and attendance quizzes. He uploads all powerpoints to d2l and practice exams. He's a fun professor and makes lectures simple and easy, would definitely recommend taking his class.

An ideal college professor. Dr. Spears is a very easygoing, approachable teacher. All of our exams were open note with an OPTIONAL final. Our quizzes were just for attendance and were silly with one question on them. This class is lecture heavy so make sure you are taking notes to help with test. Attend class, take notes, easy A.

An ideal college professor. Dr. Spears is a very easygoing, approachable teacher. All of our exams were open note with an OPTIONAL final. Our quizzes were just for attendance and were silly with one question on them. This class is lecture heavy so make sure you are taking notes to help with test. Attend class, take notes, easy A.

He is really good at explaining the information in the slides and making sure you genuinely understand it. There are lots of extra credit opportunities especially with attendance. The tests are fairly easy. As long as you get your points for attendance, you should get an A in the class.
Just a chill guy who likes gummy bears
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: Pretty easy teacher. Does attendance quizes everyday (help your grade so much). No homework. Only 3 tests and final was optional. extra credit assignments at end of year. Does not respond to emails.

Amazing teacher! Dr. Spears is very chill and very engaging with the material he teaches. This class is very easy if you show up, take notes, and study. There are attendance quizzes which are pretty easy, so just come to class and you'll be fine. If you are looking for a quick and easy class to get an A, it would be taking Dr. Spears.

Dr. Russell Spears is very laid-back. His tests are straightforward and easy to prepare for, as long as you take notes. There are attendance quizzes, so just show up and you'll be fine. If you're looking for an easy A, take his class!
Absolute GOAT. Great teacher passionate about economics. The Lebron James of econ professors, if you fail this class its because you wanted to fail this class
He is a very good professor! I liked how he uses real-life examples relating to the content. If you come to class and pay attention, it will be very hard to fail.

Great professor! Just show up to class (there are attendance quizzes) and take a few notes, his exams are all open note always and straightforward with bonus questions. He gives lots of bonus point opportunities at the end of the semester. He's friendly, answers emails decently fast, and I learned a lot!

This class was my easiest of freshman year. There are quizzes after every lecture, but are very easy. Usually just one question about the lecture. Exams are pretty easy, open note every time. Class time is usually short. Dr. Spears is a very good professor that knows the content for the class.
Professor Spears is great at explaining the material. He doesn't read off the board like my other professors do. He makes the class enjoyable and is very straightforward with directions.
very easy class to take. attendace is not mandatory but there is attendance quizzes, they only help you not hurt you. No homework and open note test. He makes lectures so funny and he is super chill.

Spears is a good professor. he makes the class easy to understand and gives lots of extra credit options. he also has good practice exams before the actual exam and has power points that are really helpful for exams.

Spears is a understanding teacher that wants his students to do well. He uses easy to understand metaphors and accessible information that is perfect for Intro Econ students. He also gives a bunch of extra credit opportunities. Very chill teacher.

he is a really good and funny teacher, he has good analogies that can transfer to real-world situations. his class was super easy and the exams are open notes where he lets you download the slide shows and use them on the exams.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: The class was easy as long as you attend the lectures. He explains the information very well and offers a lot of extra credit opportunities at the end of the semester.

Overall the class is easy if you attend and pay attention to the lectures. He makes Econ easy to understand and makes the lectures lighthearted . There's also room for extra credit assignments at the end of the semester!
Spears is a great teacher and makes his class easy for students. He brings plenty of energy to every class. He's a funny guy and is willing to help you with work if you need it.
He's great. Attendance quizzes after every class they can't hurt you though its basically extra credit. All test are open note. He cancels class a lot. He's super chill.

Very laid back, almost to a fault. Definitely thinks very highly of himself. But, that does mean the class is a VERY easy A, so long as you just take good notes.

Open note quizzes and lots of extra credit opportunities. Usually ended early.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: His tests are pretty easy. Attendance is usually 1 question about something or someone in the class like what's my favorite candy. Lectures are chill and the final wasn't hard. All tests are online with lockdown browser.

TAKE THIS PROFESSOR! This guy is the easiest A you'll ever get. I took him as a night class, rarely went and got an A. Study guides are the test, "quizzes" are questions he tells you in class like what's my favorite color or what color is my shirt. That being said join the class group chat. You cannot fail this class!
